title: Pittsburgh man to stand trial for Allentown homicide
content:
An Allentown man will stand trial on charges he shot and killed a 20-year-old man earlier this month.
Kenneth Murphy, 18, had a preliminary hearing today before District Judge James Motznik on charges that he killed Christopher Rodriguez, 20, in the 1500 block of Arlington Avenue on Aug. 1.
According to police, Mr. Rodriguez was shot multiple times. Witnesses told police that Mr. Rodriguez had said he was going to sell Mr. Murphy a gun, and that the men had spoken on the phone 20 minutes before the shooting.
In addition to criminal homicide, Mr. Murphy is charged with receiving stolen property, possession of a prohibited firearm, tampering with evidence and robbery.
